Greatest Common Divisor and Extended Euclidean Algorithm

GCDEEA.Rd

Computes the greatest common divisor (GCD) of two integers using the Extended Euclidean Algorithm. This algorithm not only computes the GCD but also finds coefficients \(s\) and \(t\) such that: $$g = a \cdot s + b \cdot t$$ where \(g\) is the GCD of \(a\) and \(b\).

GCDEEA(a, b)

Arguments

a

An integer. The first number for which the GCD is to be computed.

b

An integer. The second number for which the GCD is to be computed.

Value

A list with three elements:

\(g\)

The greatest common divisor of \(a\) and \(b\).

\(s\)

The coefficient of \(a\) in the linear combination that equals \(g\).

\(t\)

The coefficient of \(b\) in the linear combination that equals \(g\).

Examples

# Compute the greatest common divisor and the coefficients for 30 and 12
result <- GCDEEA(30, 12)
print(result)
#> $g
#> [1] 6
#> 
#> $s
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $t
#> [1] -2
#> 

# Expected output: A list with the GCD, and coefficients s and t
# Example output: $g
# [1] 6
# $s
# [1] 1
# $t
# [1] -2
